subanswer.text: First calculate what percentage got eaten overall; add together all percentages first then divide by number of groups because these are independent actions here not sequential or dependent upon one another per se. In other words you could think about dividing out the extra 'two times' portion since its kindof arbitrary if your just looking at proportionally speaking...So lets go ahead & solve those parts separately! Let's figure our initial amounts down individually based off group sizes mentioned above(this part might seem superfluous but wanna be sure u know why im doing tht):

direct_answer.text:
Firstly, we need to determine how many pizzas were consumed by the glee club and the football team respectively before factoring their respective order ratios. This can simply calculated using basic arithmetic operations like multiplication which follows BODMAS rule (* means multiply). Here goes :

Given that Glee Club orders= 2966647 Pizzas  
Football Team Orders -> Twice As Much , i.e., Football_Team_Orderes*2    =>    2*(2966647)       ==>     5933294 Pizza/pieces  

Now it’s time calculating consumption rates expressed as decimal fractions equivalent too Percentage values provided within problem statement :-    ::   ///////::::

Percentage_Consumed_by_footballTeamt   ====>          .8                               %%
